content.data: Optimize
image1280.gif

The Optimize button, once depressed, will begin the Optimization, once 
 selected the Optimizing Screen will appear.

With 
 a Saw Selected
image295.gif

You 
 can override the Run Number here if necessary.  This field is incremented 
 each time you optimize. This number is then used to determine the actual 
 run number for the Job. The RunCounter is divided by the user defined 
  Run 
 Number Range  and its remainder is added to the minimum range.
For example:

If the RunCounter is 723. That number is 
 divided by 100 (600-500=100) and you get a remainder of 23.

That remainder is added to the minimum range 
 (500) and the result is 523.

The Run Number is displayed at each of the 
 Optimize dialogs. You can override the  current 
 run number by typing in a new value (disabled for a preset number).

If you change the run number to 100 for example. The next time a/the job 
 is optimized the Run Number will default back to your normal range and 
 the next increment based on the calculations above.
Information.png

Click on the Run button to 
	 begin the Optimization process.

Click on the Run button to 
	 begin the Optimization process.

Click on the Run button to 
	 begin the Optimization process.
image296.gif

Once the Optimizing is completed 
	 this screen will display each Material optimized with the total number 
	 of sheets, the Used percentage, the Offcut percentage, and the Waste 
	 percentage.

Once the Optimizing is completed

	 of sheets, the Used percentage, the Offcut percentage, and the Waste 
	 percentage.

Once the Optimizing is completed 
	 this screen will display each Material optimized with the total number 
	 of sheets, the Used percentage, the Offcut percentage, and the Waste 
	 percentage.

You can at this point 
 Print the completed section by clicking the Print button or by clicking 
 the OK button you can accept the results and move on to the  Patterns 
 Area  of the S2M Optimizer.
